intro: Hieracium paucidentatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium paucidentatum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
